```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
scene = canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)
initial_height = 5  # initial height of the ball (m)
initial_velocity = 10  # initial velocity of the ball (m/s)

# Objects
ground = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, initial_height, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.blue, make_trail=True)

# Initial Conditions
ball.velocity = vector(initial_velocity, 0, 0)
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Simulation Loop
while ball.pos.y >= 0:
    rate(100)
    ball.pos.x += ball.velocity.x * dt
    ball.pos.y = initial_height - 0.5 * g * t**2
    t += dt

    if ball.pos.y <= 0:
        ball.velocity.y *= -1  # reverse the y component of velocity for bounce

```
